column4: So, after 15 hours of trying to get my driver to work I need someone experienced.. If anyone wants to help me setting up my internet on linux that would be great. Some information here: http://bpaste.net/show/1424/ - but I have alot of extra information, infact I tried everything what was listed on guides for my adapter. Anyone could help? Thank you very much.
whats the problem you are facing
it doesn't work, no wlan0 interface, etc.
you want to use wlan or ethernet? and whats the make of your computer
wlan, 'make of', what do you mean?
who manufactured your hard ware
get the terminal and type ifconfig
read the pastebin.. ifconfig only shows eth/lo
ok, let me reboot and get it, then i'll pastebin it.
ifconfig -a showed the same as ifconfig.. note that I got an USB adapter.
it's not built in.. lsusb lists my adapter.. ifconfig -a: http://bpaste.net/show/1427/
just hold on a second
seems your wlan adapter is not identified at all
ist a usb adapter?
yes, it's an adapter plugged into the usb-port (siemens gigaset usb adapter 108)
it works fine on windows
i will have to check then....bcoz i forget most of the commands....and in the mean while checkout whether anyone else is able to help you and try to get in touch with the hw guys to help you out
ok, well, i'm trying it for ~15h so I tried *almost* everything, lsusb seems to show the chipset id fine (129b:160c)
the one i have is also a usb but it is inbuilt. so i never faced a problem like yours.. i will try to get a solution and post it in the forums
I think it's a hardware problem, which forums? I'd also like to post my errors and such
i'll post it @ ubuntuforums.org under Networking & Wireless.
ok i will check out and reply as soon as possible
thanks
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1355912, if you want to reply later.
